entries.text:
Know thyself.
For the unexamined life is not worth living.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.text:
You become what you think.
As you imagine, so you create.
As you act, so you become.
entries.author: Upanishads

entries.text: There is nothing permanent except change.
entries.author: Heraclitus

entries.text: When the mind is pure, joy follows like a shadow that never leaves.
entries.author: Buddha

entries.text: We suffer more in imagination than in reality.
entries.author: Seneca

entries.text:
What we are today comes from our thoughts of yesterday.
Our present thoughts build our tomorrow.
entries.author: Dhammapada

entries.text:
No man ever steps in the same river twice.
It is not the same river, and he is not the same man.
entries.author: Heraclitus

entries.text: He who conquers himself is the mightiest warrior.
entries.author: Confucius

entries.text: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
entries.author: Aristotle

entries.text:
Peace comes from within.
Do not seek it without.
entries.author: Buddha

entries.text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
entries.author: Marcus Aurelius

entries.text:
You will not be punished for your anger.
You will be punished by your anger.
entries.author: Buddha

entries.text: Man is disturbed not by things, but by the view he takes of them.
entries.author: Epictetus

entries.text:
Desire is never satisfied by the enjoyment of desire.
It only grows stronger, like a fire fed by ghee.
entries.author: Bhagavad Gita

entries.text:
Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls.
The most massive characters are seared with scars.
entries.author: Kahlil Gibran

entries.text:
At the center of your being you have the answer.
You know who you are and what you want.
entries.author: Lao Tzu

entries.text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
entries.author: Plato

entries.text: He who is harmony in heart and mind is beyond sorrow.
entries.author: Bhagavad Gita

entries.text: You cannot travel the path until you become the path itself.
entries.author: Buddha

entries.text: If you realize that all things change, there is nothing you will try to hold on to.
entries.author: Lao Tzu

entries.text: The obstacle is the path.
entries.author: Zen proverb

entries.text: Silence is better than unmeaning words.
entries.author: Pythagoras

entries.text:
The wise man lets go of all results.
He is at peace before the beginning and after the end.
entries.author: Bhagavad Gita

entries.text: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
entries.author: Plato (attributed)

entries.text: The measure of wisdom is joy.
entries.author: Aristotle

entries.text:
As is your desire, so is your will.
As is your will, so is your deed.
As is your deed, so is your destiny.
entries.author: Brihadaranyaka Upanishad

entries.text: The greatest victory is to conquer yourself.
entries.author: Plato

entries.text:
A jug fills drop by drop.
So does the heart, with patience and virtue.
entries.author: Buddha

entries.text:
Those who know do not speak.
Those who speak do not know.
entries.author: Lao Tzu

entries.text: He who sees all beings in himself, and himself in all beings, knows no fear.
entries.author: Isha Upanishad

entries.text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
entries.author: Marcus Aurelius

entries.text: When you are content to be simply yourself, and do not compare or compete, everybody will respect you.
entries.author: Lao Tzu

entries.text: Learning is an ornament in prosperity, a refuge in adversity, and a provision in old age.
entries.author: Aristotle

entries.text:
Hatred does not cease by hatred.
It ceases only by love.
This is the eternal law.
entries.author: Buddha

entries.text:
A man is what his deep desire is.
As his desire is, so is his will.
As his will is, so is his deed.
As his deed is, so is his destiny.
entries.author: Upanishads

entries.text:
Be humble, for you are made of earth.
Be noble, for you are made of stars.
entries.author: Serbian Proverb (ancient Stoic sentiment)

entries.text: He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.
entries.author: Lao Tzu

entries.text: The one who masters himself through discipline and insight is truly liberated.
entries.author: Dhammapada

entries.text: Do not say a little in many words but a great deal in few.
entries.author: Pythagoras

entries.text: To understand everything is to forgive everything.
entries.author: Buddha

entries.text:
You are what your deep, driving desire is.
As your desire is, so is your will.
As your will is, so is your deed.
As your deed is, so is your destiny.
entries.author: Brihadaranyaka Upanishad
